summary:
Independent consultant and technical advisor. 
Experience: Creative and Responsible Media, Entertainment Education (Edutainment) C4D (Communication for Development ), Conflict and Peace, Youth rights, Gender Justice, Women Leadership, Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights.

Camera journalist - production of video productions for a variety of organizations and companies. 

Singer / Vocal coach / Choir leader

courses.name: Camera Journalism – two-year training at Open Studio in Amsterdam as self-recording camerawoman and editor.
Entertainment Education Training – Soul City/Oxfam - South Africa

Internship at women’s rights organization Breakthrough India. Learning about an organisation which takes bold action for social justice using a potent mix of media, arts, and tech to inspire and reach people where they are.

Master’s thesis in Political Science (International Relations) at the University of Amsterdam. Title thesis: Las Políticas (inter) nacionales de población y las construcciones de adolescentes bolivianos/as acerca de la SSR
Post doctorate course on Prostitution: ‘The local and Global Complexity’ InDRA, Amsterdam; Gender and Knowledge. Universidad Mayor de San Andrés (La Paz)

Study Political Science: International Relations. Expertise: development-issues, globalization, relation North/South, environmental- and population issues, gender, reproductive and sexual health and rights, women organizations, informal sector.
‘Zijnsoriëntatie’ - two-year training - Western path of enlightened art of living.

profile_positions.description:
Fundacion Imaginario y Citurna. 
Strategic advice and co-design of the funding and partnerships strategy for ‘Romper el Silencio’ (Break the Silence), a unique and comprehensive Edutainment program, that harnesses the power of drama and storytelling for peace building and social mobilization. This program supports the work of Colombia’s Truth Commission and Integrated Peace System of Colombia and ia developed in collaboration with BBC Media Action, Heartlines (South Africa) and Communication initiative platform. Funders: the Deutsche Welle Academy (DWA) and Friedrich Ebung Stiftung (FES Colombia, FESCOL).
profile_positions.title: Colombia. Fundraising and strategic advise on SBCC and Edutainment

profile_positions.description: Co-founder and board member of the Netherlands Myanmar Solidarity Platform: Fundraising, lobby with Dutch government, and engagement with Myanmar diaspora in The Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Founding Board Member

profile_positions.description: Senior Project coordinator Buurt Energie Systeem (BES) Alliander en Tertium. Project-managed a team assembling content for a knowledge management project on neighborhood energy system pilots across the Netherlands. In the process, worked with system analyst to develop and feed a bespoke content-management system developed for the project.
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Coordinator

profile_positions.description: Consultancy for Myanmar multi-donor trust fund Joint Peace Fund (JPF). Duties involved training, advice, mentoring, narrative development; Implementing civil society consultations for a stakeholder mapping in several states and regions of Myanmar; Storytelling project / TV content development on peace and the impact of conflict with the Burmese broadcaster Democratic Voice of Burma (DVB).
profile_positions.title: Advisor Behavior Change – Public Engagement Programme

company.name: Maung Tee Kya Soh (Beat the Gong) Communications for Development Forum

profile_positions.company: Maung Tee Kya Soh (Beat the Gong) Communications for Development Forum
profile_positions.description: Initiator of Maung Tee Kya Soh (Beat the Gong) conference, involving fundraising, organization, production and evaluation of the first ever Media and Communication for Development Forum in Myanmar. A three-day forum attended by over 200 development specialists to explore, reflect and celebrate communication, media and edutainment work in Myanmar and across the region.  BBC Media Action, UNICEF, Search for Common Ground, WWF, British Council and a number of CSOs and CBOs presented their experiences how popular culture and entertainment can positively contribute Myanmar’s future. Organization of a 3-day training course on participatory video making and citizen journalism for 40 young people from across the country prior to the forum.
profile_positions.title: Initiator and organizer

profile_positions.description: Organization and fundraising to bring a Myanmar youth delegation to the Social and Behavior Change Communication (SBCC) Summit in Bali. Collaboration with the New Zealand Embassy in Myanmar.
profile_positions.title: Initiator and organizer, Myanmar youth delegation to SBCC summit

profile_positions.description:
Clients included:
Oxfam Novib: 
•	Production, script development, acting and editing of seven video tutorials on interview techniques for the Monitoring and Evaluation Tool ‘World Citizen Panel’. https://vimeo.com/158442793.
•	Production and script development of a documentary on Edutainment to combat Violence Against Women in Bangladesh. 
•	Production, script development, filming and editing for a short film on inequality in Niger portraying two adolescents from a poor and a rich family for Oxfam Niger. 
•	Research and production for a multi-media project on Oxfam Novib’s Inequality campaign. http://www.rijk-arm.nl/
•	Video supporting a multi-country program on governance. Inspirational talks. 

Various
•	Music Documentary Water-Woestenij (Raging-Waters), about a forgotten flood in the Netherlands in 1916. Fundraising, research, production, scriptwriting, sound and narrator. Composer and singer of the song ‘Dance of the Southern Sea’, included in the documentary. https://vimeo.com/151362041 (trailer).
•	Educational tutorial on the costs and benefits of an integrated approach for the social domain for Economic development agency LPBL. Production (camera, sound, editing). 
•	Film research project on Argentinian folk music.  Filming and recording musicians. https://golondrinasproject.wordpress.com
•	Final products can be found on my vimeo channel: https://vimeo.com/user29972216 
•	Strategic advisor on Entertainment Education (Edutainment) initiatives in the Netherlands (Sofia Works).
profile_positions.title: Director

profile_positions.description:
GOLONDRINAS are swallows - songbirds, and fast flyers. Ester Veldhuis (voice), Modeste (bass) and  Pieter Jan Cramer van den Bogaart (accordion) are the musical trio Golondrinas and in that capacity they perform folk songs from Latin America but also Spain, Cape Verde and North -America. Poetic lyrics and melodies in the tradition of the nueva canción Music of Eduardo and Juan Falú, Leguizamon, Victor Jara, Jorge Fandermole, Lhura, Lhasa de Sela, Mayra Andrade, Tom Jobim, Joni Mitchell and more. They were guests at the Crossing Border festival in The Hague, at ArtBase in Brussel, in the Roode Bioscoop and worked with the PanAm project of photographer Kadir van Lohuizen.  Last year they were inited as Artists in Residence in the Noorderparkkamer where, together with  en guest musicians Oene van Geel (violin) and Bart Fermie (percussion) they gave a sublime concert. At this moment they are working on a new album. An interview at Radio 1 can be listened to via: http://www.radio1.nl/item/133473-Golondrinas.htm and some songs of the new album via: http://golondrinas.bandcamp.com/ 
More information: https://www.facebook.com/Golondrinas.Amsterdam
profile_positions.title: Musician, singer

profile_positions.description:
Program Officer (PO) South East Asia desk managing partner portfolios. Co-developer of a funding proposal on sexual and reproductive health and rights for young girls and boys in Egypt, including a component on the use of Entertainment for social change. 
Co-author of the publication Women Leading Change.
profile_positions.title: Programme Officer

profile_positions.description: Program Development of Pop Culture with a Purpose - up scaling experiences of successful edutainment organizations in 11 countries. Oxfam and UN Trust Fund.
profile_positions.title: Program Development of Pop Culture with a Purpose

profile_positions.description: Promoting linking and learning between Oxfam’s counterparts. Responsibilities:  building alliances, developing materials and scaling up experiences. Focus on entertainment education (edutainment) as well as: gender, SRHR, GBV, women leadership, climate change and value chains.
profile_positions.title: Knowledge Management Specialist

profile_positions.description:
- Program officer Latin and Central America Desk 
- Press officer
- Campaigner Make Trade Fair 
- Organiser/interpreter  for the international coffee campaign
profile_positions.title: Various positions
